title: (b) and (c) of section 16(1) of the Finance Act 2020 (No. 26 of 2020) shall come

1. This Order may be cited as the Finance Act 2020 (Section 16(1)) 

(Commencement) Order 2022.

title: (b) and (c) of section 16(1) of the Finance Act 2020 (No. 26 of 2020) shall come
heading: 2. The 6th day of April 2022 is appointed as the day on which paragraphs
text_raw:
2. The 6th day of April 2022 is appointed as the day on which paragraphs 
(b) and (c) of section 16(1) of the Finance Act 2020 (No. 26 of 2020) shall come 
into operation. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

29 March, 2022. 

PASCHAL DONOHOE, 
Minister for Finance. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 1st April, 2022. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [142] 3

title: (b) and (c) of section 16(1) of the Finance Act 2020 (No. 26 of 2020) shall come
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

This Order specifies the date on which paragraphs (b) and (c) of section 16(1) of 
the Finance Act 2020 (No. 26 of 2020) come into operation. These paragraphs 
amend the information that is to be retained by a chargeable person and provide 
a requirement that those responsible for the collection and return of encashment 
tax make automatic returns of this information to Revenue. The date specified is 
6 April 2022.
